content: How can I help you today?

I've been having trouble sleeping lately, and I’m not really sure how to deal with it. My mind races every night, and I end up doom-scrolling on my phone instead of sleeping. It’s just been a really stressful time with work and everything else.

It sounds like this has been a challenging time for you, with stress impacting your sleep and leaving you stuck in a cycle at night. What do you think is the hardest part about trying to rest right now?

Honestly, it's that I can't shut my brain off. I keep thinking about work and how bad things are there. I worry all the time about getting fired and not being able to support my family, and once I start thinking about it, it just spirals out of control.

It sounds like those worries about work and family are weighing heavily on you, and when your mind starts racing, it can feel overwhelming and hard to stop. How do you feel this stress is affecting other parts of your life?

I think it’s affecting everything. I’m more irritable, I don’t have the energy to really connect with my kids, and my partner has noticed too. I feel like I’m not being the parent or partner I want to be, and that just adds to the guilt and stress. It’s like a never-ending cycle.

It sounds like you're carrying a lot right now—the stress of work, the worry about your family, and the guilt about how it’s affecting your relationships. It must feel really tough trying to manage all of that. What do you feel would help you break this cycle, even just a little?

I don’t really know. I mean, maybe if I could figure out how to get better sleep, it might make things feel less overwhelming. But even then, it feels like the work stress is always going to be there, so I’m not sure how much that would actually help.

It can feel discouraging when the stress seems like it’s always present, but focusing on small changes—like improving sleep—might help ease how overwhelming things feel, even if it doesn't fix everything. What steps have you considered, if any, to try to improve your sleep or manage stress?

I’ve thought about putting my phone down earlier, but it’s so hard because it’s become my way to distract myself from all the racing thoughts. Other than that, I don’t really know what else to try, and honestly, I’m not sure if anything will actually work.

It sounds like your phone has become a way to create some distance from your thoughts, even though it might be interfering with your sleep. That’s a lot to work through, especially when it feels like nothing will really make a difference. What would be the easiest, smallest change that feels manageable for you right now, even just to test the waters?

Maybe I could try putting my phone away for just 10 minutes before bed and see how that goes. Anything more than that feels like a big step, but maybe starting small would make it feel less overwhelming.

That sounds like a great idea—starting with something small and manageable like putting your phone away for 10 minutes could be a way to gently experiment without adding more stress. How do you think you’d feel about committing to that for just a few nights to see if it makes a difference?
I guess I could give it a try. I’m not sure if it’ll help, but it’s worth seeing if it makes even a small difference. I can try it for a few nights and see what happens.

That sounds like a thoughtful and realistic plan. Giving it a try for a few nights could be a helpful way to see if making that small change eases things even a bit. Is there anything else you'd like to talk about before thinking about next steps?
I think I’m okay to end the conversation. Thank you for speaking about this with me.
